result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric W. JUSTER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric W. JUSTER is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric W. JUSTER was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs as repeater (Heroin) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Motion hearing is set for 05-16-2014 @ 2:00 p.m. BR-3.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 04/30/2014, at 2:45 p.m.
Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Attorney Larson has filed a motion to dismiss count 1. The defendant has a valid prescription for Suboxone.
The Court will take this motion under advisement.
Attorney LaBre states that if verification of a valid prescription is shown, the State will dismiss count 1.
On count 2, the defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court finds that the defendant's waiver is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made and binds the defendant over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT  -
Information filed. (applicable only to counts 2 and 3 at this time).  
NOT GUILTY pleas entered. Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-25-14 at 2:15 p.m.
Motion hearing is set for 05-16-14 at 2:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 06-18-14 at 9:00 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count One of the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-02-14 at 11:30 a.m.  
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance on 03-31-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Copy filed.
Ann Larson, public defender.
RE:  Possess Suboxone as repeater, on 03-10-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess schedule I or II narcotics and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-31-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
